front.head: Written for my Son, to some of the Fellows of the College, who took care of the School in his Master's Absence.

lg.l: of late had a terrible Rout in our House;
If I happen'd to speak, I was sure of a Souse.
My Mamma had the Tooth-ach, and I felt the Smart â€”
O , I for ever will value thy Art:
Both Children, and Servants, to thee are beholden;
Let them do what they would, they were sure of a Scolding.
Why the Tongue cannot rest, when the Teeth are in Pain.
